images.title: sylvia duckworth / "The Boat House" at Rosehaugh Estate.
images.caption: "The Boat House" at Rosehaugh Estate. A beautiful cottage rebuilt from a disused boathouse. The pond was originally a very much larger artificial lake which also stored water for the estate's electric generator. As with other cottages on the estate, it's now a holiday rental.

images.caption: Tree bole, Rosehaugh Estate

description: This walk explores the Rosehaugh House Estate near Avoch on the south-east coast of the Black Isle, on the Moray Firth. The estate is located inland a couple of miles west of the village. The expansive estate includes peaceful woodland trails, a boating lake, waterside trails along the the Killen Burn and the ruins of the old house. There's also lots of flora and fauna with many woodland birds to listen for and look out for on the estate. From the high points there are also glorious views over the surrounding countryside. The boathouse by the lake can also be hired out as holiday accommodation.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the west there's the popular village of Beauly. It's a lovely place to visit with a number of independent shops, cherry blossom trees, a pretty square and the ruins of the 13th century priory to see. The Beauly River Walk will take you along the River Beauly with fine views across the Beauly Firth.

display_address: Otter Lodge, Rosehaugh High Drive, Avoch, Highland, Alba / Scotland, IV9 8RF, United Kingdom
